newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: First Holdings unit says in $669 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: First Holdings unit says in $669 mln loan.

text.p: First Gas Power Corp, a unit of First Gas Holdings Corp, said on Thursday it has appointed ABN-Amro Bank, Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi and Westdeutsche Landesbank as lead arrangers for a $669 million loan.
First Gas Holdings is a joint venture of First Philippine Holdings and British Gas.
First Gas in a statement said it will require $669 million to finance in part its 1,000-megawatt power plant in Batangas, south of Manila.
Peter Garrucho, First Gas Holdings president, said in the statement that financial closing of the loan is expected by the second quarter of this year.
The power project will cost a total of $880 million of which $669 million will be financed through loans and the rest from equity.

Garrucho said PCI Capital Corp will arrange for working capital loans from local banks. Commonwealth Development Corp and Kreditanstalt fuer Wiederaufbau (KfW) will also provide financing for the project.
The company will also source loans from export credit agencies which include the U.S. Export-Import Bank, the Malaysia Eximbank and the Malaysia Export Credit Insurance.
First Gas Holdings treasurer Federico Lopez added in the same statement that about 20 European, American and Japanese banks submitted bids for the financing.
The power plant which will run on condensate fuel is expected to be completed by 1999.
